Our notifications are limited to “broken” or “not-updated”How do I get alerts to go to my phone?When you purchased Daily Safety Check you provided a primary email address. We default all alerts to that address. If you would like to add an additional email address or send text alerts to a phone simply send an email to support@dailysafetycheck.com  with the phone number or email address. Your software installation package size  is very small, how can you put all of this in it?While other security vendors add feature after feature to make their software more appealing, Daily Safety Check is designed to be lightweight and for a specific purpose, to help you protect your computer. We don’t believe a multitude of “features” is essential for this. In fact in our experience, they usually only take space and slow computers down. 
To Learn More visit www.dscarmy.com

story:
75% of all lead acid batteries die prematurely because of a residue that remains on the plates and electrodes.  When this residue hardens the battery becomes resistant and can no longer function properly.  These batteries are not repaired they are replaced.

Up until now that is!

OP1 is a battery additive that is based on conductive organic polymer technology. This technology won the Nobel prize for chemistry in 2000.  OP1 is injected into the cells of any lead acid battery and penetrates the hardened residue causing it to peel off the electrodes. At the same time it coats the plates and electrodes to prevent this residue from accumulating.

OP1 has succeeded in satisfying battery makers.

OP1 is the world's first successfully developed super effective additive for the prolongation of lead acid batteries' life.

OP1 in a new battery = doubles the life of the battery.

OP1 in a used battery = will last as rated -  5 to 10 years.

OP1 in a dead battery = 1 to 3 years with proper maintenance.


OP1 works on all lead acid batteries and we have developed techniques and diagnostic procedures to qualify batteries before they are replaced.

With OP1 we are going to open the first lead acid battery repair shop. We are going to work with existing repair shops to adopt OP1 as the only alternative to costly replacements.  Cost savings for the customer - 70% or more off the cost of a new replacement.

Cost Savings  for Customers

Cars - $100 to $300

Golf Carts - $1000 to $2000 per 48V pack

Forklifts - $7000 to $15000 per 48V bank

Our repair shop will provide a lab for the different repair facilities.  Forklift, industrial, golf cart, car, boat, truck, back-up and electric vehicle batteries repair people can train, test and develop strategies to introduce OP1 to their customer base.  We will document all in order replicate this approach in any state or country around the world.

We are looking to raise $99,950 to open our OP1 repair shop and develop distribution through exiting  repair shops in the USA, as well as,  open international distribution channels.  

Training seminars and marketing materials have to be created and inventory purchased. 

The initial purchase by repair shops will be on consignment and paid for when used.  For larger batteries and rural customers, we will provide a mobile repair service. and incorporate existing mobile services. We will purchase repair and paint old trucks and vans to be stocked with OP1, replacement parts and tools. 

Already,  there are several international distribution points that require samples and demonstration of how OP1 works and its application.  

The Dominican Republic, Jamaica and Africa are starting points for OP1 Distribution internationally and we hope to contribute to the global lead clean up initiatives

http://www.worstpolluted.org/projects_reports/display/72

http://www.worstpolluted.org/projects_reports/display/96

As a contributor you will be part of a new industry that can save you, the consumer, money and the environment.  New business opportunities can develop where once there were none and you can take credit for that  or even get involved with this exciting venture.

You as a contributor will also get a chance to become a distributor in your area.  

And when you put your head down to sleep you can feel or know the mess is going to get cleaned up. 

If we don’t meet our goal then we will do the best we can with what you so kindly contributed.

 

The Impact

Lead is a toxic metal that can enter the body by inhalation of lead dust or ingestion when touching the mouth with lead-contaminated hands. If leaked onto the ground, the acid and lead particulates contaminate the soil and become airborne when dry.

Children and fetuses of pregnant women are most vulnerable to lead exposure because their bodies are developing.

Excessive levels of lead can affect a child’s growth, cause brain damage, harm kidneys, impair hearing and induce behavioral problems.

In adults, lead can cause memory loss and lower the ability to concentrate, as well as harm the reproductive system. Lead is also known to cause high blood pressure, nerve disorders, and muscle and joint pain. Researchers believe that Ludwig van Beethoven became ill and died from lead poisoning. 


It is our belief that if we slow down the number of lead acid batteries going to recycling plants or being discarded in landfills we can slow down the number 2 cause of toxic pollution around the world.  And the only way to do this is to stop replacing batteries and start repairing them.

In the USA there are over 350 Million lead acid batteries in use right now.  Recycling plants are having trouble handling the demand and are spilling poisons into our ground water.  Globally, 40% of discarded batteries are being dumped in landfills.

With OP1, 50% of these batteries can be returned to the market and will last up to 3 years.  Local businesses can be opened to repair and sell these batteries lowering unemployment, saving our children and the environment and building hope.



 

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge is trying to reverse any bad image created by inferior products or scams. We believe that with a good demonstration and training program, as well as good customer support and service, repair shops will gain the confidence needed in OP1 to offer to their customer base.  Teleconferencing Seminars and a grass roots approach to educating consumers will be vital to success.  As of today, very few people know that a product as strong as OP1 even exists.  With years of training, distribution, and technical experience we have a solid foundation to launch OP1 and start repairing lead acid batteries globally.

.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contribution doesn’t have to only be money.  Next time you get your car repaired ask the repair mechanic if they could repair batteries – would they and send them to Indiegogo.com.  You can spread the word that battery repair is inevitable and the world can use it.

story:
105% FUNDED ON KICKSTARTER 03/24/2016

All rewards are guaranteed to ship!


It's Pure Physics!

I invented such a new way to hold your smart phone or tablet in your car!


I invented a smart phone holder for a car that is so revolutionary and unique, that we’re convinced it will change the industry as we know it.  You simply insert the smart phone into the unrestricted opening.  As you release the phone. it rotates using the weight of the phone which transfers this energy to a silicone pad with tiny micro suction cups griping a small portion of the screen,  securing the device better than anything on the market.  For months, I worked to bring this revolutionary device to life. It's specifically designed for ease of use and safety by keeping the device in view without distracting from the road.  This becomes more important as the use of the GPS and applications like Waze, grow in popularity.

Two ways to Mount

1)  Utilizing any small gap in dash along with a corner with a specially formulated non damaging 3M foam tape or

2) Mount on any flat surface of the dash if corner is unavailable with the same 3M tape


Other Uses




How secure is it during bumps and hard cornering? You have to see this to believe it!


What We Need & What You Get

We raised the money for making the molds and initial inventory of the product.
We need addition funds to market our product to the world.  I plan on investing all money into building a great company.  Every pledge gives us that much more traction in a market controlled by large corporations. 

The Impact

  • I chose to launch my latest invention the Gravity X on crowdfunding platforms, because I've learned from past experience it's the consumer who decides on what they want now a days.  In the past it has been up to the big retailers to decide what they will inventory in their stores.  We are entering a new age for innovative inventors and now you the people have the power to dictate what products come to market. 
  • Buy backing our product encourages innovation!  From experience, most companies don't want to take risks with new ideas until proven, so it's the people that suffer with archaic old designs.  By backing me you will be a part of my history by helping to build a company that I promise will be devoted to bringing nothing but great new products to market. 

My experience

I'm a Boston University graduate.  In the late 80’s a designed and manufactured a dirt bike carrier the  Moto*X*Caddy, that would slide in a class III receiver and suspend the bike perpendicular off the back of the vehicle.  People said it wouldn’t work, so I proved them wrong and through the demand from the consumer 5 years later I had created a new market.  Unfortunately I was copied by more established companies.  My next product was in innovative key locator for women who carry large hand bags and can never find their keys easily.  Which I designed and manufactured solely on my own.  I produced 15,000 units to be aired on QVC.  My device called the , Goog Lite, would attach to the keys and when you shake the bag it would illuminate an intense blue led strobe for 10 sec.  The product was selected as one of Hodas favorite things on NBC’s TODAY show. 

Risks & Challenges

Production – The Gravity X team is experienced in both design and manufacturing. However, if for some reason our product is less then promised during the manufacturing process, we will remedy that before we ship to you. Should any issues arise with delays in shipment, you will be promptly notified.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help by pledging for a great reward or sharing with your friends if you think we have a great product.

story:
Studies show humans communicate primarily Non-Verbally.

Our current internet & social networks lack human tonality, gestures, and emotional cues.

 

All funds go towards app development

This is an initial family & friends seed funding round to get some traction on a working prototype

 

 

    Why We Need It

    • Communication with distant relatives in different time zones can make it hard to do a facetime, use Interactive Video messages to keep up
    • Do you have a friend you've lost touch with and can't find the time to catch up? Use Interactive Video so that they can reply to everything you want to talk about.
    • Instead of writing a politically charged Facebook comment that lacks tone, embed an interactive video  of your thoughts for others to dialogue with kindly
    • Want to share a complex idea publicly? Post an interactive video and watch as engaging responses become their own threads of video conversation.

    We grew up with AOL Instant Messenger, e-mail, chatrooms. As things moved to Facebook, and then to Instagram, Skype, Snapchat, and Facetime, I knew something  was still missing. The ability to laugh, talk, share reactions, and deeply communicate with your friends over both distance and time, when they were NOT available. Do you ever write an email, or a Facebook, or comment, and wish people could hear and understand your emotional tone? Dr. Albert Mehrabian, author of Silent Messages, conducted several studies on nonverbal communication. He found that 7% of any message is conveyed through words, 38% through certain vocal elements, and 55% through nonverbal elements (facial expressions, gestures, posture, etc). Subtracting the 7% for actual vocal content leaves 93% of communication is nonverbal

    • Texts: brief verbal-only while they are unavailable
    • Phone: long-form and carries tonality while they are available
    • Emails: long-form verbal-only while they are unavailable
    • Facetime/Skype: long and carries tonality while they are available
    • Snapchat/Marco Polo: brief and carries tonality  while they are unavailable
    • Organic Mail: long-form and carries tonality while they are unavailable

     

    How it works

    • Organic Mail is Social. You can talk privately to your friends, your family, or you can even see group chats around certain hobbies and locations, like a social network
    • Organic Mail is Natural. All messages are videos, no typing. Just pretend you're in the room with that person and talk normally
    • Organic Mail is Threaded like email threads, with multiple interwoven replies
    • Organic Mail is Interactive, so you can reply instantly WHILE you watch a video
    • Organic Mail can be sent While they are Unavailable (asynchronous) meaning you record your message and send it while the other person is busy for them to watch later. It is not synchronous like Skype or Facetime.
    • Organic Mail is Embeddable. Businesses will be able to embed it into their websites for video based customer support
    • Organic Mail is Integrated. Attach any type of files along with your message to collaborate on projects, even maps and events!
    • Organic Mail is  Private. I am an avid believer in right-to-privacy, and will be looking at even having self-hosted decentralized nodes for data so I won't even have access to the network. Host your own servers or use a friends!

     

     

    What We Need & What You Get

    I cannot build a cross-platform video cloud application in my free time. The estimated dev costs are actually closer to $400,000 to do iPhone, Android, Windows, Linux, MacOS, and include all the features.

     

    The Impact

    We need a more connected world. Thats why I am launching Organic Technologies, a business brand based on technologies that develop personal, natural, authentic ways to use technologies.

    • Organic tech will be an anti-technology pattern
    • Organic tech will connect you more to the real world, instead of disconnecting you
    • Organic tech will be healthy to use, not unhealthy

    Risks & Challenges

    I took 8 months off work and developed a working Windows, and Mac prototype of this technology. I am getting married and supporting my new family will mean I will be returning to work and I will need funding to keep the dream of healthy technology alive.

    • We already have an early alpha working prototype on Mac & Windows, and are now developing the Android version.
    • I have been programming since I was 8 years old and worked as a global technical director at Dreamworks Animation, and have managed a profitable small tech studio for 5 years, and am confident we can deliver this app to users with the right funds

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute monetarily,

    • Please pray for us, as we will be donating business licenses of this technology to help missionaries and non-profits in remote areas connect (pre-recorded & sent video is needed in remote areas, where Facetime and Skype doesn't work reliably)
    • Please share this campaign with everyone you know. Post it publically

story:
INTRODUCING TINKER USB

Tinker USB is the World's First WiFi based BadUSB. This lets you control any device over WiFi, while all you have to do is connect it to the device and it begins executing ducky script.  Tinker USB is based on Open Source hardware, so you can reprogram it to different applications or you can choose from the wide range of scripts that you can run out of the box. With the Tinker USB, you can do a lot more than what you think you can. 

          

 

LIGHTNING FAST

Tinker USB is capable of executing tasks at high speeds, what usually takes minutes or hours to perform on a keyboard the Tinker USB can execute the same task in seconds.

 

          

 

SHARE STUFF ON THE GO

With the Tinker USB, sharing passwords discreetly becomes a piece of cake. All you have to do is set it to an automated script and it's ready to share. Tinker USB comes in handy while you have to share your favorite playlists and media files with others.

 

          

 

Password Sharing

Ever had that moment where you had to login to your YouTube or PS4 account on the TV while your friends are watching well now you can just plug your Tinker USB in and select the password task in the android app and you should be logged in, in seconds.

 

          

 

EASY TO USE

The Tinker USB is simple to set up and easy to use. Out of the box, when you connect the Tinker USB to a computer, it'll open up a web page where by following a few simple instructions and you're ready to roll. 

 

          

 

ANDROID COMPATIBLE

You could use the Tinker USB to execute tasks on an android device or you could use the android application to manage the scrips on the on board storage, you can also automate a task to run after a certain amount of time.

 

          

 

SIMPLE SCRIPTING

The scripts are written in ducky language. This is just like simple English and can be written by anyone with ease.  We provide a large collection of scripts that you could directly execute and use, without any programming. 

Here is how simple Ducky Script Looks like to open up the Indiegogo Home page.

  1. DELAY 3000
  2. GUI r
  3. DELAY 500
  4. STRING iexplore  https://www.indiegogo.com
  5. ENTER

          

 

THE TWO VERSIONS

 

          

 

OUR CHALLENGES

Making a prototype and testing the product is just half the job done, when it comes to launching a product.  The rest is the hard part, manufacturing electronics on a large scale requires a lot of resources and we need your support to help us bring the Tinker USB to each and every one of you.

The manufacturing process includes importing PCBs from China and updating all the boards with our software. Also, each and every Tinker USB will be personally tested before being packed and shipped. Help us make the Tinker USB available worldwide. 

          

 

THE ROAD SO FAR

          

 

 

FAQs

 

How do I start using the tinker USB?

To start using the tinker USB all you have to do is plug it into your computer, the tinker USB will automatically take you to our getting started page.

 

How do I load new scripts and execute it onto the on board storage?

Scripts can be loaded and executed using the Tinker USB android app or you can connect to the hosted network and upload and manage your scripts.

 

How much on board storage does the Tinker USB have?

The board comes with around 3mb of storage space, this is a lot considering the most complex of ducky scripts only occupy hundreds of bytes of storage memory.

 

How do I reprogram the Tinker USB?

You can download the Arduino IDE and use that to upload scripts to the board. Full instructions will be provided in the website.

 

Why does the Tinker USB not come with an Enclosure by default?

To promote the nature of Open Source Hardware and DIY we do not ship it with an enclosure by default, we encourage you to 3D print your own cool looking enclosures or purchase the one with the enclosure. 

 

Does the Tinker USB ship to my country?

We ship the tinker USB worldwide, so as long as you have a postal address we can ship you one.

 

Does the tinker USB support my smart device?

The tinker USB works on most devices with a USB input, so it supports windows, Linux and Mac OS. It also works with most smart TVs and the PS4 and Xbox One, it runs on android and we are working on an iPhone application which should come out soon.
story_txt:
INTRODUCING TINKER USBTinker USB is the World's First WiFi based BadUSB. This lets you control any device over WiFi, while all you have to do is connect it to the device and it begins executing ducky script.  Tinker USB is based on Open Source hardware, so you can reprogram it to different applications or you can choose from the wide range of scripts that you can run out of the box. With the Tinker USB, you can do a lot more than what you think you can.            LIGHTNING FASTTinker USB is capable of executing tasks at high speeds, what usually takes minutes or hours to perform on a keyboard the Tinker USB can execute the same task in seconds.            SHARE STUFF ON THE GOWith the Tinker USB, sharing passwords discreetly becomes a piece of cake. All you have to do is set it to an automated script and it's ready to share. Tinker USB comes in handy while you have to share your favorite playlists and media files with others.            Password SharingEver had that moment where you had to login to your YouTube or PS4 account on the TV while your friends are watching well now you can just plug your Tinker USB in and select the password task in the android app and you should be logged in, in seconds.            EASY TO USEThe Tinker USB is simple to set up and easy to use. Out of the box, when you connect the Tinker USB to a computer, it'll open up a web page where by following a few simple instructions and you're ready to roll.             ANDROID COMPATIBLEYou could use the Tinker USB to execute tasks on an android device or you could use the android application to manage the scrips on the on board storage, you can also automate a task to run after a certain amount of time.            SIMPLE SCRIPTINGThe scripts are written in ducky language. This is just like simple English and can be written by anyone with ease.  We provide a large collection of scripts that you could directly execute and use, without any programming. Here is how simple Ducky Script Looks like to open up the Indiegogo Home page.
DELAY 3000
GUI r
DELAY 500
STRING iexplore  https://www.indiegogo.com

ENTER
           THE TWO VERSIONS            OUR CHALLENGESMaking a prototype and testing the product is just half the job done, when it comes to launching a product.  The rest is the hard part, manufacturing electronics on a large scale requires a lot of resources and we need your support to help us bring the Tinker USB to each and every one of you.The manufacturing process includes importing PCBs from China and updating all the boards with our software. Also, each and every Tinker USB will be personally tested before being packed and shipped. story:
A full Charliehorse kit was sent to Author Sydney Raine and her family

Here is what she had to say:

"A tablet displays sheet music while Kim (16) plays her Trombone. An iPhone perches comfortably so that Micayla (13) can Facetime with her friends and practice new hair and makeup techniques. Jude (15) uses her CharlieHorse to video chat with members of her school group leaving her hands available to do homework as they study. 

Dad has spent the past three planting seasons frustrated when the GPS unit in the tractor constantly falls off the universal holder he spent too much money on. Even though the CharlieHorse isn’t advertised for this purpose, he figured it was worth a shot and strapped in the GPS. Not only did it work and make Dad happy, the whole family was happy because in our house, if Daddy ain’t happy, ain’t nobody happy…

Since our CharlieHorse units arrived, we’ve discovered so many uses for them! Of course it straps to your leg to use your phone, tablet, etc. hands free but also: It props up tablets/phones to display recipes on the kitchen counter. We downloaded soothing lullabies on my iPhone that the baby loves! Our CharlieHorse straps it to the side of her crib so she can listen as she goes to sleep. The CharlieHorse has so many great uses, and even more we have yet to discover!"

Summary

  • Guaranteed to ship - all early-bird reward units and parts are in stock - flat shipping rate ($7)
  • Lightweight, compact, versatile, and easy to use, Charliehorse makes a great solution for home or while travelling
  • Expandable smartphone clips come standard with the base unit
  • One-year limited warranty included for any manufacturing or assembly defects - buy with confidence
  • The Charliehorse gadget was designed so that future upgrades and parts will be easily added to the current kit(s)

How Can You Help?

2 ways:

  1. Purchase a reward/product. The funds from this campaign as well as future sales will be used to:
    • Pre-order more products 
    • Continue investing in marketing to maintain growth
    • Rent production space and begin hiring employees for marketing and assembly with a commitment to hiring individuals with visible and invisible disabilities 
    • Bring component manufacturing to Canada over time to provide more high quality employment opportunities as well as to continue leaning out costs
    • Future product development - this idea has sparked ideas for accessories which will be developed along with new products
  2. Help spread the word! As mentioned below, the product development and marketing, were done without resorting to external crowdfunding incubators - this saved $10,000-$15,000, but at a cost: Charliehorse does not have the media connections the big guys have, so we need your help with sharing this product on social media.

Current Stage -> Production

  • 695 Charliehorses and smartphone clips have been assembled and boxed (right side of photo)
  • The parts for the remaining 255 earlybird products are in possession (on and below the table in the photo) and will be assembled over the launch weekend
  • 200 mini-tablet and 200 tablet expandable clips are in possession (below the table in the photo) for the rewards with additional clips

    How Charliehorse Was Born

    Like everyone else, I liked being able to video call while laying on the couch or in bed, but when they were any longer than 10-15 minutes, it became distracting to try and find comfortable positions (and not drop the phone on my face). 

    Back in November 2016 I made a cheap prototype at home to see what it could be like to not have to hold my smartphone or tablet. It did not take long at all to see that it was actually pretty handy to have. However, it was not until I introduced the idea to my friend and old roommate Marcus, who is deaf and one of our video stars, that this was a need, not just a convenience. I believe in the need so much I decided it was worth putting my life's savings, as well as the majority of many months' paychecks, on the line.

    Through skills and equipment obtained over time through education and hobbies, the engineering, graphic design, videography, photography, and marketing, along with the magic of 3-D printing, the product development and marketing could be done at very little cost in the evenings after work. This meant being able to keep the price very affordable and know exactly what needed to be manufactured.

    To speed up the market-entry process while the patent was being secured, international non-linked manufacturers were found for the individual parts. This meant safely having manufacturing secured and tested before the patent's completion.

    Once the patent was secured,  the parts for the first 1000 were purchased, are in possession, and being assembled (as pictured). 

    Are There Risks?

    • The Charliehorse gadget is patent pending, and all components for the early-bird backers are in possession and guaranteed to ship
    • Manufacturer partnerships are established and prepared for pre-orders following the early-bird rewards
    • This product was funded using personal savings, so there are no debts, and the funds collected will be reinvested in growth (more details below).

    The Price Is Low - How Did You Maintain Quality?

    • The product was designed, and developed in-house through knowledge gained while obtaining a mechanical engineering degree, and proto-typed using 3D-printing services
    • The marketing, graphic content, videos, photographs, and editing were done in-house using equipment and knowledge obtained over time through personal creative hobbies
    • It was designed to only require manufacturing of three core components and be assembled quickly and easily - in addition to the various clips 
    • The manufacturing of the individual parts is done overseas and they are assembled here in Toronto (though the aim is to manufacture locally as capital is built)
    • Though we had many offers, we avoided crowdfunding incubators which saved $10,000-$15,000 alone
    • All-together this has saved an estimated $20,000-$25,000 in crowdfunding development costs - you're paying for the product and the product alone

    Future Plans For Growth

    • Companies like 'As Seen On TV' have reached out to us to discuss distribution, seeing the same potential as you do now
    • As we grow, we will gradually purchase the machines required to manufacture the components locally in Ontario, Canada
    • As we hire employees, we will have a commitment to hiring individuals with invisible and visible disabilities

Through skills and equipment obtained over time through education and hobbies, the engineering, graphic design, videography, photography, and marketing, along with the magic of 3-D printing, the product development and marketing could be done at very little cost in the evenings after work. This meant being able to keep the price very affordable and know exactly what needed to be manufactured.
To speed up the market-entry process while the patent was being secured, international non-linked manufacturers were found for the individual parts. This meant safely having manufacturing secured and tested before the patent's completion.
Once the patent was secured,  the parts for the first 1000 were purchased, are in possession, and being assembled (as pictured). 
Are There Risks?



The Charliehorse gadget is patent pending, and all components for the early-bird backers are in possession and guaranteed to ship
Manufacturer partnerships are established and prepared for pre-orders following the early-bird rewards
This product was funded using personal savings, so there are no debts, and the funds collected will be reinvested in growth (more details below).


The Price Is Low - How Did You Maintain Quality?

The product was designed, and developed in-house through knowledge gained while obtaining a mechanical engineering degree, and proto-typed using 3D-printing services
The marketing, graphic content, videos, photographs, and editing were done in-house using equipment and knowledge obtained over time through personal creative hobbies
It was designed to only require manufacturing of three core components and be assembled quickly and easily - in addition to the various clips 
The manufacturing of the individual parts is done overseas and they are assembled here in Toronto (though the aim is to manufacture locally as capital is built)
Though we had many offers, we avoided crowdfunding incubators which saved $10,000-$15,000 alone
All-together this has saved an estimated $20,000-$25,000 in crowdfunding development costs - you're paying for the product and the product alone


Future Plans For Growth

Companies like 'As Seen On TV' have reached out to us to discuss distribution, seeing the same potential as you do now
As we grow, we will gradually purchase the machines required to manufacture the components locally in Ontario, Canada
As we hire employees, we will have a commitment to hiring individuals with invisible and visible disabilities

story:
The Next Generation Satellite System

The smartphone is our own personal computer that we always have by our side. What if it was able to do much more? This is where the Modular CubeSat comes in. A CubeSat is a small 10 x 10 x 11.35 cm cube satellite and their relatively low cost allows many researchers and students to launch satellites for research and education. They usually use consumer off of the shelf components (COTS) which contribute to their low costs but their development costs are still very prohibitive for some schools and we think that we can make the CubeSat even cheaper. 

By basing the satellite off of the Moto Mods platform, anyone who is able to develop a Moto Mod or create an Android app will be able to develop an instrument for the satellite. This will allow researchers to focus more on the development of their research instruments, and allow consumers to build their own satellite with ease. We are projecting a cost of $5000 for the build cost of the satellite.

We are a multidisciplinary team of six students at the University of California, Irvine and are excited about creating the next form of satellite development. With your help we will be able to achieve our goal of building and launching proof of concept version of the Modular CubeSat.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we only have $600 in funds to complete the project and will be completing our first fully functional prototype within the next two weeks. This is only enough to build the first two prototypes! Although the satellite itself will cost $5000 in components there is still a lot more that needs to happen in the background. In order to achieve our goal of launching a proof of concept version of the satellite we will need your help.

Here is where the funding will go:

  • Components: Even though most of the components can be bought off the shelf, some parts are still very cost prohibitive with our current budget.
  • Ground Station: What is the point of building a satellite if you can't hear back from it? We will be building a ground station that will be able to transmit and receive signals to and from the satellite.
  • Testing: High altitude balloon tests, Vibrational tests, Shock tests, Thermal Tests
  • More Testing
  • Even More Testing: The satellite has to be reliable!

We have some great perks for our backers!

  • Name on Website: Get your name on our project website
  • Polo Shirt: Receive a Polo shirt with the team logo!
  • Name on the Satellite: Have your name laser etched onto a component of the satellite!

If we are unable to reach our funding goal, the project will be unable to be ready to launch into space but we will still put in our effort into developing the satellite system as much as we can. We will then release our data to the public where hopefully someone else can complete the project.

The Impact

The Moto Mods Platform will allow:

  • Satellite development without having to design the whole satellite
  • A sub $5000 satellite
  • Allow anyone to develop their own satellite
  • Make space research more accessible to universities
  • Allow schools to easily teach about satellites and satellite development
  • Provide a surge in space related research

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please spread the word! Your word is worth as much as a monetary contribution as it will allow more people to get to see what this idea has to offer.

This project will only succeed with your help!

Thank You

story:
Why?

The Pirl Charger was born out of our frustrations with chargers. Most were poorly designed, died quickly and missed key features we wanted. So we decided to build our own from scratch.

What is it?

The Pirl Charger is built for demanding users who require fast charging, superior electrical protections, flexibility, and visibility of power usage. It charges multiple USB devices at their fastest rate with no throttling.

It delivers 2.7 amps per port and 50 watts total.

*Note that we include either a European or a US wall adapter. If you require another type, we'll include a converter specifically for your country.*  

Unlike plastic chargers, the Pirl Charger is made from aluminum and FR4. It gives it the look and feel of a more substantive object than most chargers. Something that doesn't look alien on more natural furniture, while still fitting in with modern devices.

Now in red

Powers multiple phones, tablets, headphones and other devices.  

Delivers 2.7 amps per port and 50 watts of total power.  

Intelligently detects how fast your device can charge.

The Pirl Charger performs a digital handshake that detects how much the device can handle and delivers that.

4 separate charging channels. No throttling.

Each channel is independent and there is no throttling so each port can deliver its maximum energy.

Built to last.

Robust. Built from anodized aluminum and layers of FR4 (glass-reinforced epoxy laminate). 

Higher resistance. Resists more pressure, flexural force, and buckling than typical chargers.  

Lower environmental impact. 

Easily repurposed. After first intended use, you can repurpose it for use at home, in a car, or on a workbench to power Raspberry Pis. That way, it is much less likely to be thrown away if the first use changes.

Superior protection.

Overheating. Every chip has its own independent overheating protection. If any of the chips overheat for any reason, it will shut itself down to protect the charger.

Static discharge. Electrostatic discharge (ESD) kills many consumer electronics. To defend against this, we have ESD protection chips at every port. 

Reverse polarity. Some vehicle connectors allow you to plug your devices in reverse (plus to minus, and minus to plus); fortunately, the Pirl Charger will not be harmed by such a scenario.

Fault detection per port. Each port has LEDs that light up in short circuit situations. Each output is protected against over-current and dead-shorts. The short can persist for an unlimited amount of time without harming the charger.

Independent ports. A particular port's protective response to overheating, over-current, or a dead-short does not impact the performance of other ports.

Perfect travel companion.

Surge protection. In places where the electricity grid fluctuates and there are blackouts, the charger will protect itself and your devices. 

Wire compensation.

The Pirl Charger compensates for the voltage drop across the wire into your device, meaning your device charges faster than other chargers which do not have this capability.

Pocket-sized.

First flexible input charger.

As a DC input charger with 7 to 17V input voltage, you can power it from multiple sources with the appropriate adapter, unlike other chargers that only work with wall outlets.

First charger with an integrated wattmeter.

The wattmeter shows the total power delivered to every port in use.

First charger for single board computers.

With 2.7A delivered per port at stable and low noise output current, you can overclock multiple Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+'s which draw 2.5A each. 

First maker-friendly charger.

You can make your own battery pack. In this image, we used a Turnigy 800 mAh 3S Lipo Pack and an JST-to-barrel jack connector.

You can download the STL files for the battery caddy here and 3D-print it.

What are reviewers saying?

TekThing: "I think it's a very very good device." 

 

DiodeGoneWild: “I definitely like it.” 

 

Adam Welch: “I have to say I’ve been very impressed with the build quality and the feature list.”

 

Novaspirit: “A very impressive little 4 port 2.7A each 50W USB charger.”

Comparison

The Pirl Charger has several advantages over generic chargers.

Product journey

Our initial prototypes were 3D printed with ABS material. Since each port is independent, we built single port chargers first before expanding to four ports. We then developed the wattmeter circuit independently and integrated it into the quad charger. The next piece was the casing. We used aluminum top and bottom plates. They were laser cut, sandblasted, and anodized. We used FR4 ("PCB material") for the middle layers. We then laser-etched our logo and alphanumeric characters on the top plate.

Why the name "Pirl"?

"Pirl" is pronounced like "pearl". Oysters secrete nacre to cover irritating pieces of sand that enter their shells. This is how we get beautiful jewelry. 

We're inspired to make beautiful products to solve our annoying experiences.

Specs 

Manufacturing

In April 2018, we successfully completed a pilot run with Macrofab, an experienced manufacturer in Houston, TX. This resulted in a Made in the USA product! We had a very positive experience with the pilot batch which allowed us to test their manufacturing capabilities before large-scale manufacturing.

All Brand-Name Components

All of the electronic components in the Pirl Charger are brand-name. We have parts from TI, Diodes, ROHM, Atmel/Microchip, and STMicro. Most mainstream chargers use off-brand components, no-name chips, and clones to push prices down, and are not designed to last for more than a few months of intensive use.

Rewards

What's in the box - Full pack tier 

AC/DC Adapter

We will provide a 60W power supply unit. 

We will have US and EU adapters. If your country is outside the US and EU, we will provide converters (or adapter plugs) to work with them.

 Car Adapter

We will provide a car adapter.

Gel Pad

This is a sticky, double-sided pad for mounting the Pirl Charger on any surface, including cars.

Shipping

We will ship to the following countries. 

Timeline   

  

Team

We have been working together since 2015. We were brought together by our love of hardware and our desire to build high-quality products.

To defend against this, we have ESD protection chips at every port. Reverse polarity. Some vehicle connectors allow you to plug your devices in reverse (plus to minus, and minus to plus); fortunately, the Pirl Charger will not be harmed by such a scenario.Fault detection per port. Each port has LEDs that light up in short circuit situations. Each output is protected against over-current and dead-shorts. The short can persist for an unlimited amount of time without harming the charger.Independent ports. A particular port's protective response to overheating, over-current, or a dead-short does not impact the performance of other ports.Perfect travel companion.Surge protection. In places where the electricity grid fluctuates and there are blackouts, the charger will protect itself and your devices. Wire compensation.The Pirl Charger compensates for the voltage drop across the wire into your device, meaning your device charges faster than other chargers which do not have this capability.Pocket-sized.First flexible input charger.As a DC input charger with 7 to 17V input voltage, you can power it from multiple sources with the appropriate adapter, unlike other chargers that only work with wall outlets.First charger with an integrated wattmeter.The wattmeter shows the total power delivered to every port in use.First charger for single board computers.With 2.7A delivered per port at stable and low noise output current, you can overclock multiple Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+'s which draw 2.5A each. First maker-friendly charger.You can make your own battery pack. In this image, we used a Turnigy 800 mAh 3S Lipo Pack and an JST-to-barrel jack connector.You can download the STL files for the battery caddy here and 3D-print it.What are reviewers saying?TekThing: "I think it's a very very good device."  DiodeGoneWild: “I definitely like it.”  Adam Welch: “I have to say I’ve been very impressed with the build quality and the feature list.” Novaspirit: “A very impressive little 4 port 2.7A each 50W USB charger.”ComparisonThe Pirl Charger has several advantages over generic chargers.Product journeyOur initial prototypes were 3D printed with ABS material. Since each port is independent, we built single port chargers first before expanding to four ports. We then developed the wattmeter circuit independently and integrated it into the quad charger. The next piece was the casing. We used aluminum top and bottom plates. They were laser cut, sandblasted, and anodized. We used FR4 ("PCB material") for the middle layers. We then laser-etched our logo and alphanumeric characters on the top plate.Why the name "Pirl"?"Pirl" is pronounced like "pearl". Oysters secrete nacre to cover irritating pieces of sand that enter their shells. This is how we get beautiful jewelry. We're inspired to make beautiful products to solve our annoying experiences.Specs ManufacturingIn April 2018, we successfully completed a pilot run with Macrofab, an experienced manufacturer in Houston, TX. This resulted in a Made in the USA product! We had a very positive experience with the pilot batch which allowed us to test their manufacturing capabilities before large-scale manufacturing.All Brand-Name ComponentsAll of the electronic components in the Pirl Charger are brand-name. We have parts from TI, Diodes, ROHM, Atmel/Microchip, and STMicro. Most mainstream chargers use off-brand components, no-name chips, and clones to push prices down, and are not designed to last for more than a few months of intensive use.RewardsWhat's in the box - Full pack tier AC/DC AdapterWe will provide a 60W power supply unit. We will have US and EU adapters. If your country is outside the US and EU, we will provide converters (or adapter plugs) to work with them. Car AdapterWe will provide a car adapter.Gel PadThis is a sticky, double-sided pad for mounting the Pirl Charger on any surface, including cars.ShippingWe will ship to the following countries. Timeline     TeamWe have been working together since 2015. We were brought together by our love of hardware and our desire to build high-quality products.

story:
Overview

OpenMandriva is a non-profit association, a fully independent organization that manages, governs and develops its own Linux Distribution, it’s roots are in the Mandrake-Mandriva community. We have been developing this operating system for two years. Our contributors are all volunteers, who believe and invest in the world of free software which aims to produce software which is free of any backdoors (spyware). Our legal headquarters are in France, but our contributors and members come from  30 countries from all around the world.

We believe that our operating system should be free to the user, adaptable and technically advanced but at the same time easy to use.

This comprehensive and modern operating system is available for you to install and use right now, feel what free feels and feel free to download OpenMandriva Lx 2014.1 from

http://openmandriva.org/


If it is here, why are we running a campaign?  Our next release is scheduled for May 2015 and we need your help to support and further improve this high quality product.

The last two releases were downloaded dozens thousands times and the reviews we have been getting have encouraged us to continue. See for yourself!

Jesse Smith, Distrowatch says: “The operating system (OpenMandriva Lx 2014.1) is stable and the interface looks friendly. For the most part, the distribution worked very well for me. OpenMandriva has a sense of polish and friendliness about it which is hard to qualify, but is certainly there. The system installer, the Control Centre and the pretty (yet traditional) desktop environment all appear to be designed to be as newcomer friendly as possible. I was especially impressed by the systemd front end. <...> OpenMandriva did a beautiful job of smoothing over the details of systemd while presenting a functional front end. 

<..> OpenMandriva 2014.1 is one of the best efforts I have seen to date to take back the “beginner friendly” crown. This distribution was easy to set up, easy to use, has a great control centre and should appeal to both novice users and power users alike. I was happy and a bit impressed with OpenMandriva 2014.1 and I recommend giving it a try.” 

http://distrowatch.com/weekly.php?issue=20141110#feature

Gaël Duval, Mandrake founder :"OpenMandriva Lx 2014.0 seems to be quite solid and finished. It’s a level of quality that can only be achieved when experienced developers and contributors are really engaged in a project. Most hardware devices are supported and configured by default. Certainly a very good root for the next releases.

Congrats to the OpenMandriva team for this release!” 

http://www.indidea.org/gael/blog/?p=444

Silviu Stahie, Softpedia: “(OpenMandriva Lx 2014.0 Beta) is a breath of Fresh Air with a KDE Soul”.



What We Need & What You Get

The effort needed to create these release is all done by volunteers drawn from all over the world.  We need funds to support our infrastructure (primarily for hosting the servers), for occasionally buying development hardware when necessary (such as contemporary ARM boards) and to represent our work at some of the major Open Source events (for example  FOSDEM, LinuxTag) , to exchange  knowledge, promote our work and learn of new and upcoming innovations that we can incorporate in our system. The total amount needed to keep these activities going is $27, 500 USD for the year 2015.

For now we are running this campaign with a lower target of  $15, 000 USD and  hope that that we can call on your help to help reach the needed amount!

We do believe that thousands of our users and those who will become users, or those who simply support good Open Source products will make it happen. In case we do not reach full target, whatever the amount achieved it will be spent for the same purposes, we will just have money for smaller time period.


What do you get?

A friendly and easy to use, yet advanced operating system, that is user-oriented. We listen to the community, conduct regular user polls and align the development of the product most possible close to the users desires. We keep it free, open and welcome new contributors, who are eager to learn  in a friendly and professional atmosphere. With your help we are building the bricks that will make the pavement of a free road.

We do our utmost to be in the vanguard of OpenSource innovation examples of which will be seen in our latest release where we have switched to LLVM/clang as our default compiler we will be one of the first notable distros to be offering this. Enjoy this and other fresh innovations with us!

http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=MTgzMzI



Risks & Challenges

What are the risks? That the development of the system is not completed is the only possible risk, which is at almost 0, since the community is continuing to grow with new contributors joining, this has been progressing for over 2 years now. There is no great risk for the project as long as we can raise the necessary fund to maintain our webservers and keep our infrastructure.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate now, but would like to contribute, you can still help by:

  • getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign in your blog, telling your friends, sharing in social networks - everything will help!

  • using Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about us!

  • coming over and joining us! Programmers, translators, designers, infra or PR pros and learners - we grow and will be glad to welcome you! Just email few words about yourself to join@openmandriva.org!

story: INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN CANCELED. WE RELAUNCHED ON KICKSTARTER.
